titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Michael Roemer Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Mary Caldera

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of drafts, screenplays, notes, school papers, poems, writings by and about Michael Roemer, and documents regarding publication.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creator(s) of this collection for materials they have authored or otherwise produced. After the lifetime of the creator(s), copyright passes to Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Michael Roemer Papers (MS 1837). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Michael Roemer, filmmaker and professor at the Yale School of Art, was born in Germany in 1928. He left Germany during World War II and lived in England until 1945 when he emigrated to the United States. He attended Harvard University and made his directorial debut in 1949 with A Touch of the Times . Following graduation, he made educational films and documentaries before making his first fictional film, Nothing But a Man , in 1964. Nothing But a Man earned two awards at the Venice Film Festival. In addition to making feature films, Roemer has continued to make documentaries, including Dying (1975), a film about several terminally ill cancer patients.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of drafts, screenplays, notes, school papers, poems, writings by and about Michael Roemer, and documents regarding publication.

did.unittitle: Writing by and about Michael Roemer
Heartbreak House , "Introduction: A Note on Literary Theories"
Act of God , Losing Emily , Mortal Longing , Stone My Heart
Correspondence and drafts of article on Charlie Chaplin
A Collection of Bunce Court Memories

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 2012-M-038 addition to the Michael Roemer papers includes drafts, notes, and scenes from the screenplay Been Here and Gone . Drafts include handwritten edits and marginalia.

odd.head: General
odd.p: The folder includes notes for Sneaking into Eden .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession includes drafts and manuscript copies of screenplays for Michael Roemer's films, Bed Rock and Home Body , as well as original notes pertaining to each film.
